== Be Sure To Have ==
 * Add Additional Compile Arguments - "-extra war/WEB-INF/deploy"
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-examples/source/browse/trunk/DemoRequestFactory/src/META-INF/persistence.xml META-INF/Persistence.xml] 
 * war/WEB-INF/lib/requestfactor-server.jar
 * war/WEB-INF/lib/gwt-servlet-deps.jar - you'll need the org/json|org.json classes in this...
 * It is mandatory to have in the server entity method find[EntityClass](Long id) - [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-examples/source/browse/trunk/DemoRequestFactory/src/org/gonevertical/server/domain/NameData.java see source]

== Request Factory Validation Tool - Manual ==
 You'll have to run the validation tool to setup the RequestFactory piping! 
 * You know this worked if more files show up in your class path - next to the request factory
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-examples/source/browse/trunk/DemoRequestFactory/ValidateRequestFactoryTool.sh See Source] - See the latest source of the Validator Tool Builder .sh
 * [http://code.google.com/p/google-web-toolkit/wiki/RequestFactoryInterfaceValidation Wiki Ref doc] - notes on whats going on here
{{{
#!/bin/sh
# made by Brandon Donnelson
# http://gwt-examples.googlecode.com

# Project Path to Web-inf folder (with no trailing /)
BASE="/Users/branflake2267/Documents/workspace/DemoRequestFactory/war/WEB-INF";

#----------------------------
# don't have to edit below - unless you have more Application Request Factories

OUTPUT="$BASE/classes";

CP="";
CP="$CP$BASE/classes:";
CP="$CP$BASE/lib/*:"; # '*' will only work with java 1.6+

# these need to be in there
#CP="$CP$BASE/lib/requestfactory-apt.jar:";
#CP="$CP$BASE/lib/requestfactory-server+src.jar:";

echo "DEBUG ClassPath: $CP";

java -cp $CP com.google.web.bindery.requestfactory.apt.ValidationTool $OUTPUT \
  org.gonevertical.client.requestfactory.ApplicationRequestFactory 
  # Do you need more Request Factories???
  

# the end
exit;
}}}

== Request Factory Validation Tool - Automatic ==
 Setup the project to do it automatically. Right click on project > goto properties > Java Compiler > Annotation Process... then follow the wiki ref link directions.

 * [http://code.google.com/p/google-web-toolkit/wiki/RequestFactoryInterfaceValidation Wiki Ref] - Screen shots on how to do it.
 * How to setup the client processor - should be automatic I think. [http://code.google.com/p/google-web-toolkit/wiki/RequestFactory_2_4#RequestFactorySource_and_Annotation_Processing]
